at the end of the party.

You can only have one
companion in your party.

You move the Nintendo 3DS
system when playing,
so be careful of your
surroundings.
Do you want to start now?

friends to play together!

Visit islands from friends
and play with them.

Press "Ok" when you're ready.

Feature cannot be used due
to parental restriction.

Battle with players close
to you via local play!

Battle with players all over
the country via Internet.

Check your statistics from
local and online battles.

Waiting for a player
to battle with.

Search for players around your
area to battle with them.

communication battle.

Waiting for a player.
 Press "Start" when ready.

Select the name of the person
you want to battle with.

Check the local communication
battle statistics.

Check the Wi-Fi communication
battle statistics.

Fight and participate in
ranking battles!

Register your party to use it
for ranking battles!

Check the explanations for
Wi-Fi battles.

Local Battles is a Coliseum mode in which
nearby players can fight against
each other via local play.

The team who defeats the opponent's
Denpa Men wins. If the battle exceeds round 10
the player who dealt the most damage wins.

After the battle, you can
do a rematch by
pressing the "Play again" button.

Local Play not possible due to
different game versions.
Update your game via Check-in.

Local Play not possible due to
different game versions.

Wi-Fi Coliseum is a mode in which all players
across the country can compete
against each other for rewards!
Tournaments are held daily.
Feel free to check it regularly!

In Wi-Fi Coliseum, the team who defeats
the opponent's Denpa Men wins.
If the battle exceeds round 10, the player
who dealt the most damage wins.

After a battle, you'll receive ranking
points depending on your performance.
You can battle as many times you want.
Only the highest score will be used
for the rankings.

When you finish a battle,
you'll receive or lose player points
depending on whether you won or lost.
After reaching a certain number of points
you'll be promoted to a higher class.

If you get a good position on the ranking
you'll receive great rewards.
The deadline to claim the reward is
one day after the tournament ended.
Don't forget to claim your reward on time.

Even if you're offline, other players
can battle against you and you can
receive player points by winning.
Check the coliseum regularly to get
these player points!

You can fight with your current party or
your registered party. If you don't want
to change yourcurrent team for coliseum
you can always use your
registered team instead for ranking battles.

Coliseum can't be used as the
game's version is outdated.

Each class has its own "Max Level".
If Denpa Men exceed this level, their current
level will be adjusted to the highest
possible level in that class.
"Max Level" increases for each class and is
unlimited for Class A.

After winning a certain number of battles,
you'll receive a prize. The higher
your victory count, the better is usually
the prize. This type of prize is
seperated from ranking battle
leaderboard rewards.

Check the rewards for
each class in ranking battles.

If your player points fall below the
minimum for your class,
you'll be demoted back to the next
class at the end of the tournament.
Since Class E is only for beginngers,
you'll remain in Class D no matter if you
are below the minimum point requirement.
